Job Title: Environmental Scientist/Geologist

Location: Cleveland, OH

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Consulting, Engineering, Science

Description:
Haley & Aldrich is a 900+ personnel national engineering and environmental consulting firm with creative, technically strong staff who want to work in a collaborative environment to deliver exceptional value to our clients. We look for professionals with a passion for solving even the most complex client problems. This problem-solving ability and opportunity to be a change agent is a vital part of our culture, no matter what level or role a staff member holds.

We are currently seeking an Environmental Scientist/Geologist that will support a variety of challenging multi-disciplinary environmental investigation and remediation projects under various voluntary, state, and federal programs. This individual will interact with clients and help manage projects that require site characterization, environmental investigation and remediation, regulatory agency interaction. This is an excellent opportunity to join a growing group and company and get involved in a variety of projects for a diverse range of clients. This is a full-time position located in our Cleveland, OH office.

Duties/Responsibilities

The successful candidate will: 


 Demonstrate a strong commitment to safety, including following established Haley & Aldrich and client health & safety protocols and procedures. As applicable, participate in site safety briefings and audits by both contractors and Haley & Aldrich.  Work collaboratively with a technical team supporting heavy industry, manufacturing, attorney, developer, and energy clients with a diversity of challenging projects.  Take an active role in and ownership of each project and assigned task, even if the work effort is outside of the candidateâ€™s core competencies, while seeking guidance from other technical/senior management,  Assist with planning of and provide technical, engineering, and design contributions to site investigations, remedial alternatives analysis, remedial design, and closure implementation projects to address client goals and objectives.  Support planning and directing of environmental field observation and testing programs, including health & safety management, subcontractor coordination, technical support and laboratory test selection and data evaluation.  Prepare proposals, work plans, technical reports/presentations and regulatory compliance submissions for client deliverables including findings and recommendations from a variety of civil and environmental engineering projects.  Support management of projects to meet technical, quality, budgetary and scheduling requirements. 


Skills/Experience


 B.S. in Environmental Science, Geology, or similar discipline. M.S. preferred.  Professional license in Ohio, New York, Indiana, and/or Michigan or ability to obtain licensure preferred.  5 -10 years of professional services consulting experience.  Experience and understanding of various field sampling and data collection methods/technologies and multiple regulatory programs.  Excellent written and verbal communication skills are a must which includes proficient writing, review, and editing of technical reports, feasibility studies and basis of design documents to meet scope and quality objectives and client expectations.  Willingness to accept direction and project responsibilities including office and field assignments with a demonstrated record of self-directed and motivated attitude toward learning and career growth.  Strong computer literacy skills including a working knowledge of industry standard software is required. Experienced with figure drafting in AutoCAD/Autodesk and/or ArcGIS a plus  Strong organization skills and an attention to detail is expected.  Positive attitude, strong work ethic, flexibility, and willingness to see projects through to completion is a must. 


About Haley & Aldrich

Haley & Aldrich, Inc. is committed to delivering the value our clients need from their capital, operations, and environmental projects. Our one-team approach allows us to draw from our 900 engineers, scientists, and constructors in more than 35 offices for creative collaboration and expert perspectives. Since our founding in 1957, we have had one goal in all we do: deliver long-term value efficiently, no matter how straightforward or complex the challenge. Visit haleyaldrich.com .

Haley & Aldrich is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applications will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender, race, age, disability, veteran or any other legally protected status. We offer excellent career growth, a highly competitive total compensation plan and a solid benefits package and you can find a detailed list of all our benefits here . Interested candidates should apply online on our Careers page .

Note to External Search Firms: Haley & Aldrich does not accept unsolicited resumes and will not be obligated to pay a placement fee for unsolicited resumes. Haley & Aldrich Talent Acquisition engages with search firms through CrowdStaffing directly for hiring needs.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
